item.itunes:author: ESPN, Bomani Jones
item.itunes:subtitle: The Town Fool
item.content:encoded:
Bomani Jones weighs in on Nets PG Kyrie Irving “talking himself out of the NBA” with anti-Semitic rhetoric (0:57). Plus, an IYHH including the ramifications of billionaire Elon Musk’s purchase of Twitter (28:51), and your voicemails about that time “your mama showed up early” (42:11)!

item.title: Nelson George on new Willie Mays Documentary
item.description: Bomani talks with author and film maker Nelson George about his upcoming documentary on Willie Mays: why now was the right time for the film (5:45), on Mays being part of the access generation and not being a civil rights activist (10:15), Mays' connectivity to the community in Harlem (21:01), Barry Bonds' participation in the documentary (29:47), the basket catch, and how he views this film as the Black Field of Dreams (33:28). item.itunes:author: ESPN, Bomani Jones
item.itunes:subtitle: Legacy Play
item.content:encoded:
Bomani Jones weighs in on “Father Time” catching up with both Buccaneers QB Tom Brady and Green Bay QB Aaron Rodgers, but in different ways (0:30). Plus, the unfortunate situation that the Lakers have found themselves in (16:17), an IYHH including the K-Pop band BTS reporting for military service in South Korea (34:02), and your voicemails from giving the proper amount of respect to security (47:15)!

item.itunes:author: ESPN, Bomani Jones
item.itunes:subtitle: Subconscious Desire
item.content:encoded:
Bomani Jones shares thoughts on why Bills-Chiefs may be the most exciting QB matchup ever in the league (1:00), what makes Tennessee’s victory over Alabama this past weekend such a big deal (13:53), and why his visit back to Clark Atlanta this past weekend made him think harder about 60 Minutes’ feature on Jackson State coach Deion Sanders (23:16). Plus, an IYHH including Police using DNA to generate 3D images of suspects (30:16) and your voicemails from bad loans you have got yourself into (40:46).


  1. @chloexiang shares police are using DNA to generate 3D images of suspects they’ve never seen: https://bit.ly/3EMtnki

item.title: Big Brother
item.itunes:author: ESPN, Bomani Jones
item.itunes:subtitle: The Right Time: Who is actually good so far this NFL season & Draymond Green apologizes.
item.content:encoded:
Bomani Jones shares his thoughts on who is actually good so far this NFL season, including a dive into teams on the halfway line, like the Packers, Rams, and 49ers. Plus, Warriors F Draymond Green apologizes for punching teammate Jordan Poole after the video gets leaked, an IYHH including the FCC threatening carriers over “robocalls”, and your voicemails from when you “tried” your old man.


IYHH Stories

  1. @susrust shares that the bird flu has spread to Southern California, infecting chickens, wild birds and other animals: https://lat.ms/3EDXFWi 
  2. @sequoiastweets shares that a win 16 years in the making for a group of student loan borrowers is huge news: https://n.pr/3MlRbxt 
  3. Our last story is about how the FCC threatens to block calls from carrier: https://bit.ly/3EMIj2b 

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Playing the Long Game
item.itunes:author: ESPN, Bomani Jones
item.itunes:subtitle: The Right Time: The Last of the Backup QB's, Eagles Start Strong, Why I Quit Football!
item.content:encoded:
Bomani Jones discusses the QB situation in Dallas, and takes you on an intellectual journey trying to figure out why we seemingly don’t have competent backup QB’s across the league these days (0:49). Plus, the performance of Kansas City QB Patrick Mahomes and the Eagles’ strong start (15:15), an IYHH including "Nyquil Chicken" (29:36), and your voicemails from that time you "quit" playing football (41:22)!


IYHH Stories

  1. @rachel_treisman shares that Twitter says it's testing an edit button — after years of clamoring from users: https://n.pr/3ft153I
  2. @bydanielvictor shares that an F.D.A. warning on NyQuil chicken alerts many to existence of NyQuil chicken: https://nyti.ms/3dXkLwx
  3. @ayewolfe says former Gov. Phil Bryant moves to keep texts private, denying he helped channel welfare funds to Brett Favre’s volleyball stadium: https://bit.ly/3rsYE42

item.title: Foxworth Friday: Russell Wilson Boo'd, Lamar Jackson's Contract, Robert Sarver Violates Workplace Standards with Suns
item.description:

item.title: Howard Bryant talks his new book 'Rickey', and the NBA Finals
item.description:
Howard Bryant of ESPN and Meadowlark Media talks with Bomani Jones about his new biography of Hall of Fame OF Rickey Henderson, titled "Rickey" (1:56). They get into Henderson's impact on the sport, how much the culture of the sport has changed, and how the city of Oakland has played a role in all of it. Plus, Howard's take on the NBA Finals thus far (38:22).
The Right Time Recommends...
“Rickey: The Life and Legend of an American Original” by Howard Bryant
“The Warmth of Other Suns” by Isabel Wilkerson
“The Promised Land: The Great Black Migration and how it Changed America” by Nicholas Lemann

item.title: Foxworth Friday: Working in Majority 'White' Spaces, 'Non-Athletes' Across Sports, NFL's 'Accelerator Program'
item.description:

item.title: Foxworth Friday: Finding dignity in work, Dak's doubters & remembering Michael K. Williams
item.description:
Bomani Jones and Domonique Foxworth discuss finding dignity and purpose in work once your playing days are over and Domonique’s piece about Cowboys QB Dak Prescott, including what he has to do to convince people he’s the real deal. Plus, the guys remember actor Michael K. Williams following his passing, who famously played the character of “Omar Little” in the HBO series “The Wire”.
The Right Time Recommends
"Hillbilly Elegy" by J.D. Vance
"Sex, Lies and Headlocks: The Real Story of Vince McMahon and World Wrestling Entertainment" by Shaun Assael

item.title: Cognitive Dissonance
item.itunes:author: ESPN, Bomani Jones
item.itunes:subtitle: The Right Time: The Hall of Fame ceremony, the NBA Playoffs, your stories on quitting your jobs...and a little surprise!
item.content:encoded:
Bomani Jones recaps the Basketball Hall of Fame ceremony from this past weekend, including the inductions of Rudy Tomjanovich and Kobe Bryant (1:13). He also shares the cognitive dissonance the NBA must be feeling now that the Lakers will be playing the Warriors in the play-in tournament (14:26). Plus, an IYHH including real estate prices soaring around the world (27:03) and your voicemails from “quitting on the job” (40:31)!

item.title: Am I a Dummy?
item.itunes:author: ESPN, Bomani Jones
item.itunes:subtitle: The Right Time: Aaron Rodgers wants out, Kyle Shanahan takes Trey Lance
item.content:encoded:
Bomani Jones examines Aaron Rodgers’ failed “Draft Day” attempt to force a trade away from Green Bay and how the Packers have handled transitions away from their Hall of Fame QB’s (1:58). He also applauds coach Kyle Shanahan for “not being a dummy” and drafting QB prospect Trey Lance at #3, exposing the “dumbest draft narrative in the history of draft narratives” (18:32). Plus, an IYHH including Amazon opening up a hair salon in London (31:29) and your voicemails from encountering the “repo man” (42:00)!

item.description: Bomani Jones tries to get a handle on why this NBA season feels “different” and why viewership is down (1:19). His theory, in a word, LeBron. item.title: Foxworth Friday: The Right Time Live!
item.itunes:author: ESPN, Bomani Jones
item.itunes:subtitle: The Right Time: Foxworth Friday for The Right Time Live!
item.content:encoded:
Bomani Jones and Domonique Foxworth join for a show in front of a live audience for the first time to look back on college and the Black fraternity and sorority experience. They also delve into the obscurity of NFL draft analysis, including the lack of criticism for White QB’s, player types that have "evolved" out of the game and more (20:00). Plus, an IYHH including President Joe Biden’s German shepherd going for training after biting two people (40:54) and your “why I quit football” voicemails (54:32)!

The Right Time Recommends

  • @Foxworth24 on how Seattle’s Richard Sherman pick in 2011 changed the next 10 years of the NFL

item.content:encoded:

He also compares the story of a mistaken identity that evolved around Rams DL Aaron Donald over the weekend to a WWE wrestling brawl (16:16). Plus, an IYHH including an angry octopus (26:08) and your voicemails from the most awkward date that you have ever been on (36:25)!

item.title: Heartbreak
item.itunes:author: ESPN, Bomani Jones
item.itunes:subtitle: The Right Time: Final Four reactions, Roy Williams retires, Braves issue statement after ASG move and more!
item.content:encoded:
Bomani Jones reacts to Gonzaga’s victory over UCLA in the Final Four and connects it to the “reasons” behind the retirement of legendary North Carolina coach Roy Williams (1:13). He also shares why the Braves’ response to MLB moving the All-Star Game from Atlanta hurt him personally (15:27). Plus, an IYHH including the impact of blockage in the Suez Canal (29:00) and your voicemails from heated Twitter beefs that you have had (43:24).

IYHH Stories

  1. @ReedAlbergotti on the dangers of trusting the Apple App Store after someone’s life savings was stolen by a fake app. https://bit.ly/3t4YMGh
  2. @greene on Amazon picking a Twitter fight over claims that workers resort to urinating in bottles. https://bit.ly/3sO5TCC
  3. @concertina226 on the cost of the Suez Canal blockage. https://bit.ly/3wwnjGj

item.title: More Questions than Answers
item.itunes:author: ESPN, Bomani Jones
item.itunes:subtitle: The Right Time: 49ers make a big trade, NCAA Tournament and your stories about people quitting their jobs in amazing fashions!
item.content:encoded:
Bomani Jones questions the motives of 49ers decision makers Kyle Shanahan and John Lynch and their future planning at the quarterback position, following their trade up to the #3 pick in the upcoming NFL draft (1:13). He also shares concern for the future of college basketball following his observance of a lack of talent and phenomenon during the Sweet 16 of Match Madness (14:22). Plus, an IYHH including a study about America “putting on the pounds” in the pandemic (25:49) and your funniest voicemails from when someone “quit on the job” (41:54).

IYHH Stories

  1. @RoniNYTimes on a recent study into weight gain during the COVID-19 pandemic: https://nyti.ms/3u5HMzK
  2. @kyurieff shares that Google doubling down on office space despite the rise in remote work: https://cnn.it/3flCwUt
  3. @dalvin_brown on Facebook’s plan to let you control augmented reality with your thoughts: https://wapo.st/3m6ykcn

item.title: Foxworth Friday: QB commitments, NFL TV deals & free agency money
item.description: Bomani Jones and Domonique Foxworth discuss NFL front offices juggling the stock of their starting Quarterbacks like Mitch Trubisky and Jimmy Garoppolo in Chicago and San Francisco respectively, in light of the Bears signing Andy Dalton and tweeting out “QB1” from their admin account (0:40). Plus, they dish on the future of “money” for the NFL through the lens of the television deals that were just signed (13:04) and how a player’s “money” gets affected when signing in free agency (29:02). Foxworth also tells a story of what it was like to play in a “contract year”. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: 3x Champion Bruce Bowen bounces around the NBA
item.description: Bomani is joined by friend of the show and three-time NBA champion Bruce Bowen to catch up and discuss the NBA season (3:50). They get into the development of players across the league and touch on funny stories from playing in Europe early in his career. Plus, sifting through the top stories in the West (15:59) and East (27:32) like LeBron James’ injury, Phoenix’s resurgence, Nikola Jokic’s MVP-caliber play, the evolution of Kevin Durant’s game, the Celtics’ issues and much more!
